snippet: President Obama pressed lawmakers on Tuesday to pass a package of limited spending cuts and tax changes to avoid the across-the-board reductions set to take effect on March 1.
abstract: Pres Obama calls on Congress to quickly pass new package of limited spending cuts and tax increases; urges lawmakers to avoid substantial across-the-board reductions to domestic and military spending set to begin March 1; appeal for more revenue is dismissed by Republicans.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and JACKIE CALMES

lead_paragraph: President Obama pressed lawmakers on Tuesday to pass a package of limited spending cuts and tax changes to avoid the across-the-board reductions set to take effect on March 1.

headline.seo: Obama Urges Congress to Reach Deal on Spending Cuts
headline.main: Obama Urges Congress to Act to Stave Off Cuts
headline.print_headline: President Urges Congress to Act to Stave Off Cuts
